fact: To begin the quest, talk to Catherine in Fallbrook.
She explains to you that Clive Lumbergh,
the self-proclaimed Boarst King of Monarch, has been making a killing,
according to Malin, by "...making the only meal to be had this side of Monarch..."
She decides that she no longer wants to go through Clive to get boarst and would rather take over the factory herself.
So she asks the Stranger to deal with Clive.
She also suggests speaking to Duncan Elley at Dry Goods & Sundry about a disguise prior to leaving town.
the canning machine
The C&P Boarst Factory is located west of Forlorn Crossroads.
The factory will be surrounded by Corporate soldiers and one will need a Boarst Factory ID Cartridge to enter the factory peacefully.
To get one, the Stranger should speak to the guard who greets them at the front door.
Either lie, persuade, or intimidate in order to receive the ID.
make your way to Clive's office and confront him.
You have a few choices in handling the situation.
You can either kill Clive,
blackmail him into a partnership,
or persuade him into letting you kill Catherine instead.
The easiest way to complete the quest is to simply shoot Clive in his office.
Convincing him to work with Catherine will require a Medical skill of 55 and will reward you with 7000 XP.
Return to Catherine Malin in Fallbrook and propose a working relationship with Clive Lumbergh.
C&P Boarst Factory is a location in the Monarch Wilderness on Monarch dedicated to the processing and canning of cystypig products such as Boarst Wurst or Boarst 'n Baked Beans.
The factory is owned and run by Clive Lumbergh.
After the hazard clause came into effect and C&P abandoned Monarch like the other companies,
the factory's original employees started showing up to shifts less and less and did not receive their wages.
Eventually the factory stopped its operations until Clive Lumbergh took over and made the factory operational again,
hiring new employees, as well as some of the old ones who had not left Monarch yet.
Under Clive's leadership, the employees were paid well and had steady work,
however their shifts were 23 hours long, and they needed to document the entire shift in 15 minute increments once it had ended.
Clive also threatened the employees frequently and had them call him King.
The cystypigs in the factory are fed human meat,
such as employees who have been given pink slips or disobeyed,
various other Monarch residents such as an Iconoclast and a scientist whose bodies can sometimes be found in the cystypig pens,
and conditionally also the bodies that SubLight's Fallbrook operations may accumulate.
The human remains that Clive is preparing in his office can also be identified as such with a medical skill of 55 during Slaughterhouse Clive.
Catherine Malin is the outpost administrator of Fallbrook and owner of Malin's House of Hospitality.
Catherine, acting on behalf of SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation, is the "top dog" in Fallbrook, and a mastermind behind it's construction.
She is known for a violent temper and won't hesitate to hire a hitman to get somebody whacked.
Sanjar Nandi is afraid of Catherine.
According to him, she has certain ambitions for Stellar Bay and Sanjar fears asking her for help during Errors Unseen because it may give her the leverage she has been looking for.
Celia, his assistant, tries to calm him down and says it's perfectly normal to have a healthy fear of her.
Clive Lumbergh is the self-proclaimed boarst king of Monarch and owner of the C&P Boarst Factory.
A "self-made man" in his own eyes, who believes himself to be "rich in meat and money".
Catherine Malin takes notice of Clive's profits and status and wants to take over the factory.
She eventually asks The Stranger to help her gain control of the factory,
by either killing Clive or by offering a partnership between the two.
Cystypigs are creatures in The Outer Worlds.
Bred by the local corporations, cystypigs are pigs that grow bacon tasting tumors on their necks,
which then slough off when matured, ready for harvesting and packaging into "sustainable meat product."
The hooves of slaughtered cystypigs are used as a feed supplement, which provides rich amounts of protein.
At the C&P Boarst Factory, Clive Lumbergh maintains that cystypigs are to be fed exactly five cans of Boarst Wurst each meal every day.
Bred by the local corporations,
cystypigs are pigs that grow bacon tasting tumors on their necks,
which then slough off when matured,
ready for harvesting and packaging into "sustainable meat product."
The hooves of slaughtered cystypigs are used as a feed supplement,
which provides rich amounts of protein.
At the C&P Boarst Factory,
Clive Lumbergh maintains that cystypigs are to be fed exactly five cans of Boarst Wurst each meal every day.
Duncan Elley runs Dry Goods & Sundry in Fallbrook.
Fallbrook is a company town located on Monarch,
loosely run by the SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation.
Fallbrook is a small town built into the side of a mountain,
whose construction was masterminded by Catherine Malin.
Fallbrook has a lot of activities to offer to its visitors,
from those who search for activities of leisure to those with proclivities for vice.
Forlorn Crossroads is a fast travel location in Monarch Wilderness.
Monarch, previously known as Terra 1, is one of the many moons of the gas giant Olympus and the site of a failed colony.
Terra 1 was initially designated as the primary colonization target of the Halcyon system.
The Halcyon Holdings Corporate Board had intended to completely terraform the moon,
wiping out the local fauna and flora and replacing it with plants and wildlife native to Earth.
However, the terraforming process unexpectedly caused the native species to mutate and grow to significantly larger sizes,
rendering them more dangerous and severely crippling the colonization effort.
Due to the hostile environment which they had created,
the Board was forced to enact a Hazard Clause covering the entirety of Terra 1.
Public notice of the clause's issuance was sent to everyone operating on Terra 1 and led to the evacuation of almost all corporations from the moon.
However, one corporation took advantage of the chaos of the evacuation to exploit a legal loophole which allowed them to,
as the last corporation remaining on the planet,
acquire the planet from the Board.
This corporation, under the leadership of Sanjar Nandi and Graham Bryant subsequently rebranded itself to Monarch Stellar Industries (MSI),
in line with the renaming of the planet to 'Monarch'.
The actions of MSI earned them the ire of the Board,
who retaliated by effectively placing the moon under indefinite embargo,
refusing to allow legal transit either in or out.
the Board aggressively spread propaganda about Monarch to convince the rest of the population that it was both uninhabited and uninhabitable.
This has greatly hampered MSI's attempts to be recognized as a legitimate corporation and is a thorn in the side of its CEO, Sanjar Nandi.
Monarch also has an ocean which goes around the moon at the "twilight band".
It is where the colonists and Monarch Stellar Industries farm their saltuna.
The saltuna is an aquatic creature native to Terra 2.
They are commonly cultivated as a food source,
being used to produce various products around the system.
The saltuna (Salmonidae salinis) is an aquatic creature native to Terra 2.

The SubLight Salvage and Shipping Corporation, also known as SubLight Salvage and Shipping or simply SubLight , is a network of "salvagers" with business ties to "transportation" and "waste disposal".
A tangled web of contractors and secretive vice presidents make up their official hierarchy,
leaving no one to speak on the record about SubLight's more legally dubious activities.
SubLight as a business operates activities that would be considered illicit by some,
amoral by others,
and at odds with the Board,
such as the takeover of abandoned space habitats,
smuggling contraband,
and serving as a front for companies to bypass the infamous Hazard Clause applied on Monarch.
According to director Lilya Hagen,
operating off of Groundbreaker,
SubLight "occupies a legal blind spot.
No one knows what [they're] licensed to do,
and that gives [their] little business some freedom."
Although the Board tolerates and sees the value of SubLight's activities,
there are still limits to what the latter can get away with.
SubLight maintains an office aboard the Groundbreaker as well as a settlement on Monarch known as Fallbrook.
